This section is intended for Configuration Items (CI) provisioning based on relationships set in the $[SP]PagerDuty Service Provisioning$[SP] table.

Actions below allow to overview dependency map and trigger CIs provisioning into PagerDuty.

Note: The relationship would only provision services matching the criteria at present. It will not provision any future services matching this criteria.

Step 1

You can add multiple set of services relationships to be provisioned in PagerDuty. Select a relationship information and Save relationship before adding a new relationship. This will continuously add the new relationships to be taken for services provisioning.

Note: PagerDuty does not handle the circular dependencies available in ServiceNow.

    Step 2

    The list of services based on all the relationship configurations you selected above will be displayed by clicking View Services. Please review the services and relationships that will be provisioned and accept it before proceeding to Provisioning.

    Note: Please click the "View Services" button to check for validation warnings before provisioning.

    Step 3

    The list of services that you have reviewed will be now provisioned in this step. Click on Provision Services to provision the services in PagerDuty account.

    Note: Once these services are provisioned you would be able to deprovision only on the CI details page per service.
